reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We did like the Eldorado Hotel in Shreveport but we will not be going back. We checked into a non-smoking room which was very nice and clean and smelled smoke-free. At night however, it smells like they are pumping smoke from the casino into your room. We smelled cigarrette smoke all night long. We have also had the same problem at the Horseshoe - smells smoky in the room at night. The casino was nice and blended very well with the lobby so you didn't feel like you were walking the gang plank to the boat. It was smaller than I thought it would be.
reviews.title: Too smoky

likes.disliked: — the smell of cigarettes coming in through the room vents at night

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The customer service was excellent ,the rooms were great,and the casino employees were out of this world. I did not realize you had to print your slip out of the machine, I thought the money stayed on your card. so 10 min. later after leaving the 1st machine i was on i realized it and so many of the employees helped me get in touch with the floor manager and the rembersed me the money i had lost. they were all so great kept checking on me making sure i was ok. you could not have asked for a better crew for the casino and hotel. Thanks Eldorado
reviews.title: Loved it

reviews.text: I stayed here for the 3rd or 4th time. I love the bathrooms. The rooms are spacious. The beds are all too comfortable ahh!!
reviews.title: Keys Don 't

reviews.text: The Spa, Well let me tell you! The Best . The action isn't bad either in the casino. The ONLY PROBLEM is the keys, I keep having to go back and have my keys fixed to get back in the room. It would get me up stairs, then go red in the room key slot. They would tell me don't put it around any thing with a magnetic strip. come on every credit card in your purse has a strip! Why don't the keys at other Casinos go dead???????
reviews.title: In 15 years this was the WORSE casino experience
nightmare in shreveport
reviews.text: The Paradise Cafe has the best Chinese Food of any where in Shreveport. The won ton soup is the very best. China town with fried noodles is as good as Chicago's.

We took off to Shreveport for the weekend and heard from a friend that Eldorado was the best choice. Having been to Vegas many times I was not expecting much from the trip but was pleasantly surprised!
reviews.title: Very Pleased

reviews.text: To be honest with you, "Eldorado" doesn't sound very grand at all and I can imagine that the name itself has probably turned away a few people. That's too bad, in my opinion Eldorado is by far the best place in town! The lobby areas are tastefully decorated, the casino has high ceilings and overall it just feels like a classy place. From what I could tell it looked like the largest casino in the area and doesn't feel nearly as cramped as the others. The smoke can be overwhelming but it's not better anywhere else. The location is great, it's adjacent to Sams Town so you can pretty much walk back and forth between the two.
reviews.title: Another great stay at El Dorado!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bathrooms and foyer: WOW! As nice as Bellagio. Huge, marble everything and spotless. The rooms weren't quite as nice but large and tastefully done. The only real problem was the bedding - it was outdated, especially with Marriott and even Holiday Inn's going modern with nicer beds and tons of pillows. Otherwise everything else was just fine.
reviews.title: Great tIme.
Eldorado Hotel and Casino
reviews.text: We usually don't ask for very much so we didn't really exercise the services here, but everybody we talked to was very polite from booking the room to housekeeping stopping and wishing us a safe trip home. We had lunch at Sportsmans Cafe, nothing amazing but good food and service.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Horseshoe gets all the attention around there and it's also very nice, but also more expensive and dated in a few areas. I was also pretty underwhelmed with their casino. While this was not Vegas, I think the Eldorado has alot of class and is a good bet if you're looking for more than just a place to gamble!
reviews.title: Great value! Great fun!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I booked a room at The El Dorado on November 15 for a romantic weekend December 8 and 9th. I looked at several hotels in the area and wanted to stay in close proximity to The Bass Pro Shop and The Boardwalk shopping district. I narrowed our choice down to Sam's Town and the El Dorado. I called ED first and when I called to request a room I was confirmed for 2 nights at a rate of $125. My husband and I were very excited about our upcoming weekend and proceeded to make reservations for dinner at Superior Steakhouse for Saturday and planned out our Christmas Shopping. When we arrived at the hotel it was about 7 pm on Friday, as we were checked in the front desk attendant advised that they only had us booked for one night. I advised this is incorrect the reservation should have been for 2. I was told that they were overbooked by 15 rooms for Saturday and they could not accomadate us. I asked to speak to the manager and was directed to a telephone off to the side and was told to dial zero for reservations. I followed their instructions and when I reached reservations the clerk reiterated what I was told from the front desk, I was also told that I could not cancel my reservation for Friday as their was a 24 hour cxl policy. I then requested again to speak to a manager. I was placed on hold and when the reservations supervisor picked up I was again told that they only had me booked for one night. She then told me that she has spoken to the reservationist that had booked my room originally and that she remembered making my reservation and that she had told me they were sold out. I find it very hard to believe that someone that speaks to hundreds of people remembers booking my room 3 weeks prior. The supervisor then turned very nasty and condescending and told me that I would have to leave the property on Saturday and that that was that, she was not saying anything else about it and she then said "bye bye" very sarcastically and hung up on me. Let's just say that I was irate. I demanded to speak to the hotel GM and waited for about 10 minutes for someone to arrive. When they arrived I explained what had happened. The GM apologized and said she would take care of us, she checked us in for both nights and asked us to please fill out the comment card explaining what had happened. The room itself was very nice, we had a great view of the city and it was very clean. We ate at the Sportsman Grill friday night and had hamburgers. Our waitress was very nice and even made me a milkshake. On Sunday when we checked out we had a big surprise. Our rate jumped from $125 to $150 Friday night and $180 Saturday night. When I inquired about the rate again I was directed to a phone to call reservations. I told them, no I am not going through that again, so the clerk called and was advised that based on their calender that was the rate. I again requested the GM, when called the GM remembered checking us in on Friday and advised to go ahead and reduce our rate. Now the nitty and gritty of this, I worked in the hosipitality industry for over 5 years, I was the reservations supervisor and then front office supervisor for a Hyatt hotel and then a sales manager for Marriott. In all my years of working and travelling I have never come across anyone as rude or condescending as I did with the supervisor on Friday everning. If I had ever acted that way I would not have had a job. The way we were treated cast a palor over the rest of our visit and really put a damper on our romantic weekend. I know we were not comped gamblers or high rollers, and we were not staying there because of the casino, we were looking for strictly lodging. We wanted to find a place that we could get away and relax. We travel to Shrevport about 4 times a year and have always stayed at The Courtyard, we wanted to find a place a little closer to shopping and restaurants, I guess next time we will be staying next door at Sam's Town.
reviews.title: Awful Service from Reservations

likes.liked: — Large soaking tub and seperate shower
likes.disliked: — Check in/ Reservations/ Lack of communication between departments

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If my experience making reservations for this hotel is any indication of how the stay will be -- We are going to regret it! But my husband is optimistic & really wants to stay at the El Dorado.
reviews.title: Making Reservations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I tried to make reservations a few weeks ago & was told that they can't book more than 90 days in advance. So I marked it on my calendar to call back on 12/3 (90 days until 3/3). When I called the nasty lady on the phone told me that they couldn't book more than 90 days in advance. I gave her a math lesson (which is probably what set her off) and explained that today 12/3 is exactly 90 days until 3/3. She went on to tell me that the price list hasn't been published so she wouldn't be able to quote me a price, but would attempt to submit the reservation in the system. Low & behold after all is said & done...... the reservation was accepted - I was given a confirmation # & quoted a price! She just didn't want to work apparently... anyway - hope you have a better experience making your reservation!
reviews.title: Bad Taste for the Eldorado

likes.liked: — We did have a nice dinner in the restaurant.
likes.disliked: — The room, the mattress, the detached toilet, the awful sheets.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our stay here was extremely disappointing. This hotel is certainly not worth the money they charged. The toilet in our bathroom was detached from the floor and rocked. There was rusty looking stuff coming out from under it and around the wall at the entrance to the bathroom. The bed sloped to the floor on the edges and the sheets were threadbare. Needless to say, we got no rest. The slots are tight and so are the comps. There is no high speed internet except for on the TV, so my husband could not check on his business while we stayed there. No refrigerators. We stay in a lot of Hilton brand hotels, like Hampton Inn and Marriott's Fairfield Inns. These are a lot nicer and about half the price. We will not be going back to Eldorado. Next time we go back to the Horseshoe.
reviews.title: Stellar!!!

likes.liked: — The soaking tub, marble tiles and bed
likes.disliked: — only one small packet of coffee in room per day

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I am a picky, discerning traveler and found the El Dorado Casino and Hotel to be absolutely wonderful!! The rooms are spacious, up to date decor, comfy beds, luxury bathroom with soaking tub (looks like a soaking tub you would see it a fine spa).
reviews.title: Hotel has been well maintained, need better Linens!

likes.liked: — Well Maintained, Clean, Moderate Upscale Hotel/Casino

reviews.text: Upon arriving at the hotel, my 2 friends and I were waiting on the customer in front of us to complete his transaction so we could check in. Well, the "customer" was an employee who asked us if we needed something. That should have been an indication of the customer service end of this hotel.
reviews.title: Needed Closer Inspection . . .
Nice hotel and not pricey
reviews.text: Our first impression of the room, as we were rushing to go to a performance at the Centurytel Center, was that it was roomy and comfortable. The bathroom, large and accommodating.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Upon closer inspection, we found the bathroom to be in need of a thorough cleaning, including the mold around the shower and some unidentifiable substance on the wallpaper. The floor in the bedroom had a dead leaf and other debris on it.
reviews.title: Best Hotel in Shreveport

likes.disliked: — Service in Paradise Cafe was slow

reviews.title: Hotel, location, good time, dec.2007
reviews.text: Upon retiring for the evening, we discovered that the beds were uncomfortable, and something in one bed caused one of my friends to have a reaction with severe itching--whether it was dust mites or detergent is unknown. Pillows were flat and my mattress had a definite concave curve to it. We could hear someone in the next room snoring.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Since we were already situated and only staying one night, I didn't request a new room. When we checked out, I told the clerk that the room had not been clean and that my friend had had a reaction. She did not seem interested nor did she say she was sorry that we had been inconvenienced. I would not recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Loved the room
